channel.title: Computer froze, now nothing
channel.description:
I was having a party, and the stereo broke, so i had my computer playing music out my window. i had it cranked all the way up for a couple hours, then out of hte blue, i heard it start skipping. I came in and it was froze, mouse wasn't even moving. I shut it down and it hasn't came on since.
either 1. I press power, fans/lights click on, screen light stays orange, 1 beep every 10 seconds. 2. I remove ram, nothing, just sits there, screen lite orange. 3. I remove proc, just turns on for a couple seconds then shuts off.
I have nothing plugged in accept power supply, monitor, and hsf. it isn't the power supply, I changed to a backup psu, no change in behavior.
I think its one of three things, proc, no warranty from newegg, 3 yea manufacturers warranty. Mobo, 1 year replacement by newegg, or ram, did have a warranty, sent in rebate, that gets rid of warranty.

item.title: Computer froze, now nothing
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

Yeah its probably the graphics card, thats usually the case…

Read full topic

item.title: Computer froze, now nothing
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

Took my friends advice and waited a bit, and it booted, but now there are horizontal lines on the screen, like rainbow colored, 3 of em. and a few random boxes of green stripes down the middle. I have been wanting to get a good graphics card, would that solve the issue? i am assuming it is mobo at this point, on board graphics fired maybe?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer froze, now nothing
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Maybe that would be the best bet, you would be sure that your stuff is good. However I’m not sure how much they test them, one could be good and you would get it sent back. I guess it would be worth the shipping for the test though.

Read full topic

item.description:

awe hell, think i should just rma the board and proc?

Maybe good, maybe bad. I really have no idea.

item.title: Computer froze, now nothing
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

so, if i rma proc, what are the chances that if its the mobo not the proc the mobo fries new proc?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer froze, now nothing
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I once worked on a lady’s computer who’s AMD Athlon XP processor was bad. It acted much like this and since I, like you, didn’t know if it was the cpu or the mobo, put her cpu into my brothers computer with a good mobo to check it out. This turned out to be a mistake as it burnt out my brothers motherboard as well.

Moral of the story: I don’t know any way to check which of the two is bad, but be careful about swapping out parts. Maybe try to send in the CPU for warranty service and see what happens?

Read full topic

item.description:

hmm, i counted 24 beeps before i got bored. 24 beeps over 240 seconds, beep…beep…beep…beep nothing else at all, just non stop beeps.

na both are brand new, bought em 7/7/08, the one was only used for 5 minutes to test the case lights n shit, then i stored it. and i tested screen too, i got the same screen x3, all screens and psu’s ive tried change nothing, still the same effect.
